title: Acts Chapter 7 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Acts chapter 7 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Acts Chapter 7 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Acts Chapter 7.

questions.question: Who appeared to Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia according to Acts 7?
questions.correctAnswer: The God of glory
questions.explanation: Acts 7:2 states that the God of glory appeared unto Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia.

questions.question: What did God command Abraham to do in Acts 7?
options: Get thee out of thy country
questions.correctAnswer: Get thee out of thy country
questions.explanation: Acts 7:3 records God telling Abraham to get out of his country and kindred to go to a land God would show him.

questions.question: How long did God say Abraham's seed would sojourn in a strange land and be in bondage?
questions.correctAnswer: Four hundred years
questions.explanation: Acts 7:6 mentions that Abraham's seed would be sojourners and treated badly for four hundred years.

questions.question: Who was sold into Egypt by his envious brethren?
questions.correctAnswer: Joseph
questions.explanation: Acts 7:9 explains that Joseph was sold into Egypt by his brethren because of envy.

questions.question: What did Pharaoh's daughter do when Moses was cast out?
options: She took him up and nourished him
questions.correctAnswer: She took him up and nourished him
questions.explanation: Acts 7:21 says Pharaoh’s daughter took Moses and nourished him as her own son.

questions.question: How old was Moses when he decided to visit his brethren the children of Israel?
questions.correctAnswer: Forty years old
questions.explanation: Acts 7:23 states Moses was forty years old when he thought about visiting his brethren.

questions.question: Where did Moses flee after he was rejected by the Israelites?
questions.correctAnswer: The land of Madian
questions.explanation: Acts 7:29 records that Moses fled to the land of Madian after being rejected.

questions.question: What appeared to Moses in the wilderness of Mount Sinai?
options: An angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush
questions.correctAnswer: An angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush
questions.explanation: Acts 7:30 describes an angel appearing to Moses in a flame of fire in a bush on Mount Sinai.

questions.question: What did the Lord tell Moses to do because the ground he stood on was holy?
options: Put off thy shoes from thy feet
questions.correctAnswer: Put off thy shoes from thy feet
questions.explanation: Acts 7:33 records the Lord telling Moses to remove his shoes because he was on holy ground.

questions.question: Who did Stephen say the people were betrayers and murderers of?
questions.correctAnswer: The Just One (Jesus)
questions.explanation: Acts 7:52 states that those hearing were betrayers and murderers of the Just One, referring to Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 7, Solomon built the tabernacle in the wilderness.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 7:47 clarifies that Solomon built a house, not the tabernacle; the tabernacle was made in the wilderness as appointed by God.

questions.question: True or False: Stephen saw Jesus standing on the right hand of God before he was stoned.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 7:55-56 describe Stephen seeing Jesus standing on the right hand of God before his martyrdom.

questions.question: True or False: The people immediately obeyed Moses when he first came to them.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 7:39-40 show that the people would not obey Moses and instead turned back to Egypt and made a golden calf.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Acts 7:1: 'Then said the high priest, ______?'
questions.correctAnswer: Are these things so?
questions.explanation: Acts 7:1 records the high priest asking 'Are these things so?' at the beginning of Stephen’s speech.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Acts 7:59: 'And they stoned Stephen, calling upon God, and saying, Lord Jesus, ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: receive my spirit
questions.explanation: Acts 7:59 records Stephen calling on God saying, 'Lord Jesus, receive my spirit' as he was being stoned.

medium.title: Acts Chapter 7 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Acts Chapter 7 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with trusting God's promises during difficult times. Based on Acts 7, what biblical truth would you share about faith and obedience?
options: God’s promises to Abraham were sure despite no immediate inheritance.
God’s blessings depend on earthly possessions only.
Faith is useless if we do not see immediate results.
Obedience is optional when circumstances are hard.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s promises to Abraham were sure despite no immediate inheritance.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:5-7 show God promised Abraham a possession he did not yet have and foretold a time of sojourning and bondage, yet Abraham obeyed and trusted in God’s plan. This teaches us faith and obedience amid uncertainty.

questions.question: How does the story of Joseph in Acts 7 teach us about perseverance and integrity in the workplace?
options: God was with Joseph and gave him favor and wisdom despite hardships.
Joseph gave up after being sold by his brothers.
Success only comes from human effort without God.
Joseph compromised his character to succeed.
questions.correctAnswer: God was with Joseph and gave him favor and wisdom despite hardships.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:9-10 explains that even though Joseph was sold into Egypt, God was with him and gave him favor and wisdom, leading to him governing Egypt. This encourages integrity and trust in God's guidance at work.

questions.question: A believer is facing family rejection for following Christ. What encouragement can be drawn from Acts 7 about God's faithfulness to His people?
options: God’s promise to Abraham’s seed remained despite family trials.
God abandons those rejected by family.
Family rejection means God’s blessing is lost.
God’s promises are conditional upon family approval.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s promise to Abraham’s seed remained despite family trials.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:6-8 reveal that even through suffering and being strangers in a strange land, God’s covenant with Abraham’s seed remained sure, showing God’s faithfulness despite family or societal rejection.

questions.question: How does Acts 7 teach us about responding to oppression and injustice in the community?
options: Moses defended his brethren and avenged the oppressed.
We should ignore injustice to avoid conflict.
Retaliation without God’s guidance is encouraged.
Oppression should be accepted as fate.
questions.correctAnswer: Moses defended his brethren and avenged the oppressed.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:24-25 shows Moses acted to defend the oppressed Israelite, demonstrating the biblical virtue of standing against injustice in a godly manner.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and God’s calling can be learned from Moses’ early rejection by his people in Acts 7?
options: God’s calling remains even if people reject you.
Rejection means you are not called by God.
Humility is unnecessary when called by God.
You must prove yourself first to be accepted.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s calling remains even if people reject you.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:26-29 describes Moses being rejected when trying to help, yet God still used him to deliver Israel. This teaches believers to stay humble and faithful despite rejection.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with prayer and personal devotion. What does Stephen’s example in Acts 7 show about perseverance in prayer during persecution?
options: Stephen prayed for his enemies even as he was being stoned.
Prayer is only for personal benefit and safety.
Persecution should stop one from praying.
questions.correctAnswer: Stephen prayed for his enemies even as he was being stoned.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:59-60 records Stephen calling on God and praying forgiveness for his attackers, showing perseverance in prayer and love even in suffering.

questions.question: How does Acts 7 encourage us to remain steadfast in the truth when facing opposition in the church community?
options: Stephen boldly proclaimed God’s truth despite opposition.
We should avoid speaking truth to keep peace.
Opposition means God’s truth is wrong.
questions.correctAnswer: Stephen boldly proclaimed God’s truth despite opposition.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:51-53 shows Stephen confronting the people for resisting the Holy Spirit and persecuting prophets, encouraging believers to be bold in truth despite resistance.

questions.question: What does Acts 7 teach about God’s sovereignty in our life challenges and deliverance?
options: God sees the affliction of His people and sends deliverance.
Deliverance depends only on human effort.
We are left to solve problems alone.
questions.correctAnswer: God sees the affliction of His people and sends deliverance.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:34-36 reveals God’s awareness of His people’s suffering and His intervention through Moses, teaching trust in God’s sovereign care in trials.

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 7, the Most High God dwells only in houses made by human hands.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 7:48-50 explain that God does not dwell in man-made temples but in heaven and earth, emphasizing humility and reverence beyond physical buildings.

questions.question: True or False: Acts 7 teaches that resisting the Holy Spirit leads to judgment and hardness of heart.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 7:51 describes the people as stiffnecked and resisting the Holy Spirit, a warning about the spiritual danger of such resistance.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Stephen, filled with the Holy Ghost, saw Jesus standing on the right hand of _____ in Acts 7.
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Acts 7:55-56 shows Stephen looking to heaven and seeing Jesus standing at the right hand of God, symbolizing divine authority and encouragement during suffering.

questions.question: Based on Acts 7, what biblical principle about forgiveness and reconciliation can be learned from Stephen’s final words?
options: Stephen prayed for forgiveness for those who were killing him.
Forgiveness should be withheld from enemies.
We should curse those who harm us.
questions.correctAnswer: Stephen prayed for forgiveness for those who were killing him.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:60 records Stephen asking the Lord not to hold their sin against them, teaching believers to forgive even in extreme trials.

questions.question: How does the account of Israel’s idolatry in Acts 7 teach us to guard our hearts against turning from God?
options: The people turned back to Egypt and made idols, showing the danger of unfaithfulness.
Idolatry was acceptable in certain times.
God allows idols as a form of worship.
Turning from God has no consequences.
questions.correctAnswer: The people turned back to Egypt and made idols, showing the danger of unfaithfulness.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:39-43 recount Israel’s rejection of Moses and worship of idols, warning believers to maintain faithfulness and resist temptation to idolatry.

questions.question: What lesson about God’s providence and family unity can be drawn from Jacob moving his family to Egypt in Acts 7?
options: God’s plan included preserving the family through hardship.
Families should avoid hardship at all costs.
Family unity is unimportant in God’s plan.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s plan included preserving the family through hardship.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:14-16 describe Jacob moving his family to Egypt where God preserved them, teaching the importance of trusting God in family challenges.

questions.question: How does Stephen’s speech in Acts 7 exemplify the virtue of boldness in witnessing for Christ despite opposition?
options: Stephen speaks boldly about Israel’s history and God’s plan even though it angers his listeners.
Stephen avoids difficult topics to keep peace.
Witnessing should be done only when safe.
questions.correctAnswer: Stephen speaks boldly about Israel’s history and God’s plan even though it angers his listeners.
questions.explanation: Acts 7:51-54 shows Stephen boldly confronting the crowd with the truth, inspiring believers to witness courageously.

hard.title: Acts Chapter 7 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Acts Chapter 7.

questions.question: What significant covenant did God give to Abraham as mentioned in Acts 7, which also marked the lineage of the patriarchs?
questions.correctAnswer: The covenant of circumcision
questions.explanation: Acts 7:8 states that God gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision, which was a sign of the covenant between God and Abraham's descendants.

questions.question: According to Acts 7, what was God's promise concerning the land to Abraham even before he had a child?
options: That he would give it as a possession to Abraham and his seed
That Abraham would build a temple there
That Abraham would never have to leave it
That Abraham would defeat all enemies there
questions.correctAnswer: That he would give it as a possession to Abraham and his seed
questions.explanation: Acts 7:5 explains that God promised Abraham the land as a possession to him and his descendants, even though he had no child yet.

questions.question: In Acts 7, how long did God say Abraham's descendants would sojourn in a strange land and be treated badly?
questions.correctAnswer: Four hundred years
questions.explanation: Acts 7:6 mentions that Abraham's descendants would sojourn in a strange land and be enslaved and mistreated for 400 years.

questions.question: Who was sold into Egypt by his jealous brothers, as recounted in Stephen's speech in Acts 7?
questions.correctAnswer: Joseph
questions.explanation: Acts 7:9 states that Joseph was sold into Egypt by his brothers due to their envy.

questions.question: What role did Joseph attain in Egypt after God delivered him from afflictions, according to Acts 7?
options: Governor over Egypt and all his house
questions.correctAnswer: Governor over Egypt and all his house
questions.explanation: Acts 7:10 explains that Joseph was made governor over Egypt and his household after God gave him favor and wisdom.

questions.question: What historical event caused Jacob and his family to move to Egypt as narrated in Acts 7?
options: A famine in Egypt and Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: A famine in Egypt and Canaan
questions.explanation: Acts 7:11-12 mention a famine (dearth) in Egypt and Canaan, prompting Jacob to send his sons to Egypt to buy grain.

questions.question: How many souls did Jacob bring with him to Egypt, as stated in Acts 7?
questions.correctAnswer: Seventy-five
questions.explanation: Acts 7:14 records that Jacob went down to Egypt with 75 souls of his kindred.

questions.question: What change in Egypt's leadership led to the mistreatment of the Israelites, according to Acts 7?
options: A new king who did not know Joseph
A foreign king who allied with Israel
A peaceful king who welcomed foreigners
A king who was a descendant of Joseph
questions.correctAnswer: A new king who did not know Joseph
questions.explanation: Acts 7:18 states that another king arose who did not know Joseph and oppressed the Israelites.

questions.question: How was Moses initially saved from Pharaoh’s decree to kill Hebrew male infants, as described in Acts 7?
options: Pharaoh's daughter took him up and nourished him
His mother hid him in the wilderness
His father sent him to Midian
He was disguised as an Egyptian child
questions.correctAnswer: Pharaoh's daughter took him up and nourished him
questions.explanation: Acts 7:21 recounts that Pharaoh's daughter rescued and raised Moses after he was cast out.

questions.question: What was Moses’ reaction when God appeared to him in the burning bush on Mount Sinai, according to Acts 7?
options: He trembled and did not dare to look
questions.correctAnswer: He trembled and did not dare to look
questions.explanation: Acts 7:32 states that Moses trembled and dared not look at the voice of God speaking to him from the burning bush.

questions.question: What was the message God gave Moses at the burning bush regarding the place he stood?
options: Put off thy shoes: for the place is holy ground
Stay here and do not move
Call the elders of Israel to this place
questions.correctAnswer: Put off thy shoes: for the place is holy ground
questions.explanation: Acts 7:33 records God's command for Moses to remove his shoes because the ground was holy.

questions.question: What was the response of Stephen's audience when he accused them of resisting the Holy Ghost and betraying the Just One?
options: They were cut to the heart and gnashed their teeth
questions.correctAnswer: They were cut to the heart and gnashed their teeth
questions.explanation: Acts 7:54 reports that the listeners were deeply angered and gnashed their teeth at Stephen after his accusations.

questions.question: Which Old Testament prophetic imagery does Stephen reference to condemn the idolatry of Israel in the wilderness?
options: The tabernacle of Moloch and the star of Remphan
questions.correctAnswer: The tabernacle of Moloch and the star of Remphan
questions.explanation: Acts 7:43 cites the worship of Moloch and Remphan as figures of idolatry for which God would exile Israel beyond Babylon.

questions.question: True or False: Stephen claims in Acts 7 that the Most High God dwells in temples made with hands.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 7:48 clearly states that the Most High does not dwell in temples made with hands, quoting the prophet.

questions.question: What was Stephen’s final prayer as he was being stoned, according to Acts 7?
questions.correctAnswer: Lord Jesus, receive my spirit
questions.explanation: Acts 7:59 records Stephen praying that Jesus receive his spirit as he was being stoned.

theological.title: Acts Chapter 7 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Acts Chapter 7 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Stephen's speech in Acts 7, what promise did God make to Abraham regarding the land?
options: God promised Abraham an immediate possession of the land
God gave Abraham none inheritance in the land but promised it to his seed after him
God told Abraham he would never live in that land
God promised Abraham the land only if he circumcised his seed
questions.correctAnswer: God gave Abraham none inheritance in the land but promised it to his seed after him
questions.explanation: Acts 7:5 states that God gave Abraham no inheritance in the land, not even a foot to set his foot on, but promised it to his seed after him. This reflects God's sovereign timing in fulfilling promises, consistent with Genesis 15:7-8, Hebrews 11:9, Romans 4:13, and Galatians 3:16.

questions.question: What was the duration God declared for the sojourning and bondage of Abraham's seed in a strange land?
questions.correctAnswer: Four hundred years
questions.explanation: Acts 7:6 records God speaking that Abraham's seed should sojourn and be in bondage for four hundred years. This period shows God's sovereign plan for Israel's trial and eventual deliverance, paralleling Genesis 15:13, Galatians 3:17, Exodus 12:40, and Hebrews 11:9.

questions.question: In Stephen's speech, who was described as being 'moved with envy' and selling Joseph into Egypt?
questions.correctAnswer: The patriarchs
questions.explanation: Acts 7:9 identifies the patriarchs as those who, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt. This highlights human sinfulness and God's providential control, consistent with Genesis 37:18-28, Psalm 105:17-22, Romans 8:28, and Genesis 50:20.

questions.question: What role did God assign to Moses after sending him to Egypt?
questions.correctAnswer: A ruler and deliverer
questions.explanation: Acts 7:35 says God sent Moses to be a ruler and deliverer by the hand of the angel appearing in the bush. This aligns with Exodus 3:10, Exodus 7:1, Hebrews 11:23-29, and Deuteronomy 34:5-7, emphasizing Moses' God-ordained leadership for Israel's salvation.

questions.question: How does Stephen describe the reaction of the Israelites to the prophet Moses in Acts 7?
options: They welcomed him and obeyed his commands
They ignored him and continued worshiping God
They would not obey him and turned back to Egypt
They made him king of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They would not obey him and turned back to Egypt
questions.explanation: Acts 7:39 states that the fathers would not obey Moses and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt, showing Israel's rebellious nature despite God's deliverance. This is consistent with Exodus 32:1-6, Numbers 14:11-12, Hebrews 3:16-19, and Psalm 78:40-41.

questions.question: What idolatrous figure did the Israelites make and worship according to Stephen's account?
questions.correctAnswer: A golden calf
questions.explanation: Acts 7:41 records that the Israelites made a calf and offered sacrifice to the idol. This idolatry is condemned throughout Scripture, as in Exodus 32:1-35, Deuteronomy 9:16-21, 1 Corinthians 10:7, and Psalm 106:19-20.

questions.question: According to Acts 7, where was the tabernacle of witness located and who instructed its design?
options: In the wilderness, as appointed by God speaking to Moses
In Babylon, as commanded by the prophets
questions.correctAnswer: In the wilderness, as appointed by God speaking to Moses
questions.explanation: Acts 7:44 explains that the tabernacle was in the wilderness, made as appointed by God who spoke to Moses about the pattern. This is consistent with Exodus 25:8-9, Exodus 26, Hebrews 8:5, and Numbers 9:15-23.

questions.question: What theological truth does Stephen emphasize regarding God's dwelling place in Acts 7?
options: God dwells only in the temple built by Solomon
God dwells in temples made with hands
God's throne is in heaven and earth is His footstool
God has no specific dwelling place
questions.correctAnswer: God's throne is in heaven and earth is His footstool
questions.explanation: Acts 7:48-49 affirms that God does not dwell in man-made temples but that heaven is His throne and earth His footstool. This echoes Isaiah 66:1, 1 Kings 8:27, Psalm 103:19, and Jeremiah 23:23-24, highlighting God's transcendence and immanence.

questions.question: Stephen accuses his audience of being 'stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears.' What does this metaphor indicate?
options: They are stubborn and resistant to God's Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: They are stubborn and resistant to God's Spirit
questions.explanation: Acts 7:51 uses the metaphor of being stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears to describe spiritual stubbornness and resistance to the Holy Spirit. This theme is supported by Deuteronomy 10:16, Jeremiah 4:4, Romans 2:28-29, and Ezekiel 36:26-27.

questions.question: What is the significance of Stephen seeing 'Jesus standing on the right hand of God' in Acts 7?
options: It indicates Jesus is being judged by God
It signifies Jesus' exalted position and intercessory role
It means Jesus is waiting to descend to earth
It implies Jesus is subordinate to the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies Jesus' exalted position and intercessory role
questions.explanation: Acts 7:55-56 describes Stephen seeing Jesus standing at God's right hand, symbolizing His exaltation and intercession, consistent with Hebrews 1:3, Romans 8:34, Psalm 110:1, and 1 John 2:1. This affirms Christ's divine authority and mediation.

questions.question: How did Stephen respond when he was being stoned, according to Acts 7?
options: He called upon God to forgive them
He called down judgment on the city
questions.correctAnswer: He called upon God to forgive them
questions.explanation: Acts 7:59-60 records that Stephen called, 'Lord, lay not this sin to their charge,' demonstrating Christlike forgiveness even in death. This mirrors Jesus' prayer on the cross (Luke 23:34), Romans 12:14, and 1 Peter 2:23.

questions.question: What role does the Holy Spirit play in Stephen's speech and experience in Acts 7?
options: Stephen is full of the Holy Spirit and empowered to witness
The Holy Spirit is silent in this chapter
Stephen blames the Holy Spirit for the conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Stephen is full of the Holy Spirit and empowered to witness
questions.explanation: Acts 7:55 states Stephen was full of the Holy Ghost, which empowered him to boldly proclaim God's truth even before death. This aligns with Luke 24:49, Acts 1:8, Ephesians 3:16, and 1 Corinthians 2:4–5, emphasizing the Spirit's enabling role.

questions.question: What does Stephen say about the law and its reception by the people in Acts 7?
options: They received the law perfectly and kept it
They received the law by disposition of angels but did not keep it
They wrote their own laws instead
questions.correctAnswer: They received the law by disposition of angels but did not keep it
questions.explanation: Acts 7:53 mentions that the people received the law by the disposition of angels but failed to keep it, highlighting Israel's disobedience. This idea corresponds with Galatians 3:19, Hebrews 2:2, Exodus 19:20, and Psalm 147:19-20.

questions.question: What does Stephen say about the prophets in relation to his audience’s ancestors in Acts 7?
options: The prophets were honored and obeyed by their fathers
Their fathers persecuted and killed the prophets
The prophets were unknown to their fathers
The prophets built the temple for God
questions.correctAnswer: Their fathers persecuted and killed the prophets
questions.explanation: Acts 7:52 describes how their fathers persecuted and killed the prophets who foretold the coming of the Just One. This reflects a pattern of rejection seen in 2 Chronicles 24:20-22, Matthew 23:37, Luke 11:47-51, and Hebrews 11:36-38.

questions.question: According to Stephen, what is the consequence God declared for Israel’s idolatry with the host of heaven?
options: God gave them peace and prosperity
God gave them up to worship the host of heaven and promised exile beyond Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: God gave them up to worship the host of heaven and promised exile beyond Babylon
questions.explanation: Acts 7:42-43 records God turning them over to idolatry and promising exile beyond Babylon due to their worship of celestial idols. This aligns with 2 Kings 17:16-18, Jeremiah 25:11-12, Ezekiel 8, and Daniel 9:2-3.
